text.tspan: An audio fle that can be played in a Scratch project, available by importing from Scratch's built-in sound library, or creating a
new recording. Sounds are played by using sound blocks, which control a sound's volume, tempo, and more.
A media object that performs actions on the stage in a Scratch project.
The background of a Scratch project. The stage can have scripts, backdrops (costumes), and sounds, similar to a sprite.
A user-created gallery in the Scratch online community that can be used to highlight projects contributed by one or many users.
The computational practice of making sure things work – and fnding and solving problems when they
A way of describing the design of Scratch that emphasizes its intentional similarity to theatre, with actors
(sprites), costumes, backdrops, scripts, and a stage.
Built directly into the Project Editor, the Tips Window is a form of getting help in Scratch.
An activity in which students share their projects-in-progress and request feedback from a diverse collection of
A changeable value or collection of values recorded in Scratch’s memory. Variables can store one value at a
time, while lists can store multiple values.
An image that is defned by a collection of geometric shapes (e.g., circles, rectangles) and colors. Contrast with
A Scratch feature that makes use of video from a webcam to detect motion or display video input on the stage.
